description: Initialize DuckSync with an existing DuckLake catalog. Use this if you already have DuckLake attached.
comment: Recommended approach for existing DuckLake users

description: Full setup - attaches DuckLake and initializes DuckSync. Use if you don't have DuckLake configured yet.
comment: Creates DuckLake catalog with PostgreSQL backend

description: Register a Snowflake data source using an existing DuckDB secret.
Define a cached query result with optional TTL and monitor tables for smart refresh.
comment: monitor_tables triggers refresh when source changes

description: Refresh a cache. Uses smart check (skips if unchanged) unless force=true.
Smart query routing - returns data from cache if available, otherwise passes through to Snowflake. Checks TTL and auto-refreshes expired caches.
example: SELECT * FROM ducksync_query('SELECT * FROM PROD.PUBLIC.CUSTOMERS WHERE region = ''US''', 'prod');
